holidays.name: International Dog Biscuit Appreciation Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to celebrating the humble dog biscuit and the joy it brings to pups everywhere. Time to pamper your furry friends with some crunchy treats!
holidays.origin: Started by dog lovers and pet industry folks to highlight the importance of dog treats in training and bonding.
holidays.funFact: In England, the first modern dog biscuit was made in the 19th century and called 'Dog Cakes'!

holidays.name: Tile Day
holidays.description: An unusual day to appreciate the handy little Bluetooth trackers made by Tile, perfect for those who always lose their keys or wallets.
holidays.origin: Begins as a marketing and community engagement day by the company Tile to celebrate finding things easily.
holidays.funFact: Tile was one of the first popular Bluetooth trackers that helped kickstart the 'losing stuff' gadget trend.

holidays.name: Single Tasking Day
holidays.description: A quirky reminder to focus on one thing at a time, ditch multitasking, and appreciate the art of single-tasking for better productivity and sanity.
holidays.origin: Created by productivity experts and writers frustrated with the multitasking culture.
holidays.funFact: Research shows that multitasking can reduce productivity by up to 40%! This day encourages you to do one thing well.

holidays.name: World Spay Day
holidays.description: An annual observance promoting the spaying and neutering of pets to reduce pet overpopulation and improve animal welfare worldwide.
holidays.origin: Organized by animal welfare organizations, including the Humane Society of the United States.
holidays.funFact: Over 2.7 million pets are born unwanted each year in the US alone — spaying helps reduce this number.
